Rulings.Edison: These rulings apply to all Union Monsters: https://edisonformat.net/rules/compendium/union-monsters
Rulings.Tengu:
(1) Once per turn, during your Main Phase, if you control this monster on the field, you can equip it to your Freezing Beast as an Equip Card, OR unequip the Union equipment and Special Summon this card in face-up Attack Position. (2) While equipped to a monster by this card's effect, each time the equipped monster inflicts Battle Damage to your opponent, destroy 1 face-up Spell or Trap Card on the field. (C) (1 monster can only be equipped with 1 Union Monster at a time. If the equipped monster is destroyed as a result of battle, destroy this card instead.)
●You may use the effect of Burning Beast to destroy a Spell or Trap Card on your side of the field.
●If a monster equipped with Burning Beast attacks your opponent's Life Points directly, and Robbin' Goblin is the only face-up Spell or Trap Card on the field, the turn player chooses whether to resolve Robbin' Goblin's effect first or resolve Burning Beast's effect first. If the effect of Burning Beast is resolved first and destroys Robbin' Goblin, then Robbin' Goblin's effect is not applied because it is a Continuous Trap Card that is no longer in play.
Rulings.Goat:
●You may use the effect of Burning Beast to destroy a Spell/Trap Card on your side of the field.
●If a monster equipped with Burning Beast attacks your opponent's LP directly, and Robbin' Goblin is the only face-up Spell/Trap Card on the field, the turn player chooses whether to resolve Robbin' Goblin's effect first or resolve Burning Beast's effect first. If the effect of Burning Beast is resolved first and destroys Robbin' Goblin, then Robbin' Goblin's effect is not applied because it is a Continuous Trap Card that is no longer in play.
●The controller of “Burning Beast” while “Burning Beast” is an Equip Spell Card may choose one of their own Spell/Trap Cards.
●If “Burning Beast” is the only Spell/Trap Card on the field when the equipped monster inflicts Battle Damage, “Burning Beast” must destroy itself.

Rulings.Base: 1. You may use the effect of "Burning Beast" to destroy a Spell or Trap Card on your side of the field.\n2. If a monster equipped with "Burning Beast" attacks your opponent's Life Points directly, and "Robbin' Goblin" is the only face-up Spell or Trap Card on the field, the turn player chooses whether to resolve the effect of "Robbin' Goblin" first or resolve the effect of "Burning Beast" first. If the effect of "Burning Beast" is resolved first and destroys "Robbin' Goblin", then the effect of "Robbin' Goblin" is not applied because it is a Continuous Trap Card that is no longer in play.

PSCT.Edison:
① Once per turn: you can activate 1 of these effects; ● Target 1 "Freezing Beast" you control; equip this monster to that target.
● Unequip and Special Summon this card in Attack Position.
② While equipped by this effect, if the equipped monster inflicts Battle Damage: Target 1 face-up Spell/Trap on the field; destroy that target.
③ If a monster equipped by this card's effect would be destroyed by battle, destroy this card instead.
© A monster can never be equipped with more than 1 Union Monster.
